channel.title: How to tone muscles using dumbells?
channel.description:
I've had a set of decent dumbells lieing around for a long time now and have never properly used them. I want to start bulking up a bit for the summer, and try to turn some of this excess fat I have in to some muscle. Can anyone give me some goods ideas and tips on how to tone and build muscle using dumbells? Any good workout plans?
Also, how much weight should I be lifting and how many reps/sets with how long inbetween? I'm a noob with all this, so any help will be valued :)

item.title: How to tone muscles using dumbells?
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

If your going to do snatches/ cling & jerk learn how to use your legs properly first or you’ll have a screwed up shoulder…

Read full topic

item.title: How to tone muscles using dumbells?
item.dc:creator: @storkme storkme
item.description:
@storkme wrote:

‘Tone’ is a backwards term. Muscle definition and size are different things, you put on muscle size by lifting weights and eating loads, you gain muscle definition by dieting and losing bodyfat.

As for exercises you can do with dumbells it depends what weight they are. Best mass builders are overhead presses, dumbell deadlifts, dumbell clean & jerk, and dumbell snatch. But yours probably aren’t heavy enough to do much with.

I recommend pull ups and push ups, just pick a target (i.e. 25 pull ups for the first few days, then 30, then 35 etc) and do it. Spend about 10-15 minutes per workout and do it say 4-5 days per week.

Also fun: http://www.bodybuilding.com/fun/mahler57.htm

Read full topic
item.source: How to tone muscles using dumbells?
